These facts testify to the deterioration of the situation in the occupied territory, both for the local population and for those who were mobilized to the ranks of the Russian army. As reported by ArmyInform, at the TOT of Luhansk Oblast, the occupiers are terrorizing the population: even a Russian passport does not help.

Title: An excavator exploded like a tank - a spectacular destruction of enemy engineering equipment
Description: The video of the combat work was released on the unit's channel. The Russian excavator was digging trenches under the forest strip when it was spotted by our aerial scouts. Our FPV drone was dispatched on site. After the maneuver, he hit the excavator exactly, which exploded with unexpected spectacle. The excavator also caught fire. -A female engineer in the scrap,- commented the video in -Totem-. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the platoon of unmanned aerial systems -Totem- of the 3rd mechanized battalion 72 mechanized brigades named after the Black Zaporozhets were able to track down and destroy the enemy pilots.

Title: Patronage in military education: NUOU launches a new international cooperation initiative
Description: About it in interview with ArmyInform was told by the head of the educational and scientific center of foreign languages ​​of the National Defense University of Ukraine, candidate of philological sciences, colonel Nataliya Vasyukova. -We are knocking on all the doors of our partners. In particular, within the framework of the strategy of internationalization in military educational institutions, the idea of ​​creating a system of patronage is laid: when a certain educational institution of partner countries or members of NATO takes a kind of patronage over a certain military educational institution,- Nataliya Vasyukova said. She also added that the implementation of this would help to create a partnership network between various educational institutions that would work not only in the direction of studying general English (General English), but also - what is extremely important today - specialized narrow-profile terminology (English for Specific Purposes). As reported by ArmyInform, one of the capital's military universities has become a leader in the study of foreign languages among defenders.

Title: A six-year-old girl was among the dead: the SBU exposed the Russian general who ordered the shelling...
Description: This is reported by the Security Service of Ukraine. It is noted that on August 19, 2023, on his order, the occupiers launched a rocket attack on the Taras Shevchenko Academic Music and Drama Theater of Chernihiv. During the air attack, the enemy used an Iskander-M cruise missile, which was launched from the territory of the Kursk region of Russia. As a result of the enemy attack, seven local residents died, including a six-year-old child. More than 200 people were injured in varying degrees of severity. The large number of dead and injured is due to the fact that the Rashist rocket attack took place in the central part of the city. In addition, apartment buildings, administrative buildings and citizens' cars were damaged during the explosion. On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service informed Nikiforov in absentia about the suspicion for h. 2 Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder). Comprehensive measures are underway to bring him to justice for crimes against our state. The investigation was conducted by SBU employees in Chernihiv region under the procedural guidance of the Chernihiv regional prosecutor's office.

Title: The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces awarded -Birds of Magyar-
Description: The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces reported this on November 30. -They demonstrate innovative and technological superiority over the enemy on the battlefield. Their skill in protecting Ukraine is recognized both by the citizens of our country and at the international level — by partners and allies. I am grateful for personal achievements and overall efficiency in the battles with the Russian invaders,- said Oleksandr Syrskyi. He expressed his belief that in the future the soldiers of -Birds of Magyar- will continue to apply innovative approaches and exchange advanced experience with other Ukrainian servicemen for the Victory over the Russian invaders. As reported by ArmyInform, Oleksandr Syrsky visited subdivisions in the Pokrovsky and Kurakhiv directions.

Title: Ukrainian Lannisters on the Polish border: a man married a sister with a disability
Description: About this informs DPSU. The man initially stated that he was taking his -wife- to Warsaw to introduce her to her parents. However, realizing that the real motives were exposed, he confessed to organizing a sham marriage. As it became known, the marriage was concluded in the middle of November. For participating in the scheme, the woman's mother was to receive a reward in the amount of 2 to 5 thousand US dollars. Border guards discovered signs of a criminal offense under Art. 332 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (-Illegal transportation of persons across the state border of Ukraine-) and transferred the case to the National Police for further investigation. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Russian shelling in Donetsk region: dozens of houses were damaged, one person died
Description: reported this by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. Pokrovsky district: In Kurakhovo, numerous houses were damaged. In Uspenivka, one house was destroyed, seven others were damaged. One house was destroyed in Merry Grove. One house each was damaged in Myrnograd and Pokrovsk, and two administrative buildings were also damaged in the latter. Kramatorsk district: One person died as a result of shelling in the village of Zarichne of the Lyman community, and a residential building was damaged. In Kostyantynivka, a private house, two industrial premises and a power line were damaged. Bakhmut district: In Seversk, a two-story building was damaged. In the Chasovoyarsk community, six private houses and two high-rise buildings were damaged. One residential building was damaged in Shcherbynivka of the Torecki community. As reported by ArmyInform, in Kharkiv Oblast, the evacuation of all children of the front-line settlements.

Title: He handed over 120,000 liters of diesel fuel to the occupiers, instead of pouring and burning them: ...
Description: Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. According to the court's decision, the man was sentenced to 10 years in prison with confiscation of property and a ban on holding positions in state authorities, local self-government and state-owned railway transport enterprises for 12 years. It is noted that the defendant voluntarily cooperated with the Russian military during the occupation of Kupyansk. He became the -head of the base of fuel and petroleum products- at the enterprise -Kupyansk railway- captured by the enemy. In June 2022, the man handed over 120,000 liters of diesel fuel to the occupiers, which was used to provide logistics and strengthen the combat positions of Russian troops near the front line. The enemy's accomplice was detained in March 2023. During the trial, he pleaded not guilty, claiming that he acted under duress. However, the prosecution presented convincing evidence that proved his voluntary cooperation with the occupiers. The decision of the Chervonozavod District Court of Kharkiv on the perpetrator's guilt was appealed by the defense, but the appellate court fully upheld the verdict. As reported by ArmyInform, inclined to cooperation with the Russians and persecuted patriots: four traitors were convicted.

Title: Conversation clubs with attachés: how the Ukrainian military overcomes the language barrier
Description: About it in interview with ArmyInform was told by the head of the educational and scientific center of foreign languages ​​of the National Defense University of Ukraine, candidate of philological sciences, colonel Nataliya Vasyukova. -Last year, we started the practice of speaking clubs for students of foreign language courses with the participation of defense attachés of the Kyiv Association of Military Attachés. Classes were held 2-3 times a month in the form of interviews, discussions with students according to their level of training,- Nataliya Vasyukova said. The goal is to consolidate the learned vocabulary and grammatical constructions in speech practice, as well as simply the opportunity to practice speaking, practicing typical communicative situations as close as possible to real ones with the participation of a native speaker (even if it is not his native language). -During such classes, students learn to overcome the psychological barrier to start speaking a foreign language, because just as it is sometimes difficult to dare to take the first step, it is also difficult to pronounce the first word, the first phrase in English (-will they understand me-, -will I not I made a mistake'', says Nataliya Vasyukova. She also emphasized that this practice of conversation clubs has spread to other higher military educational institutions that conduct foreign language courses. We will remind, create patronage between types of military educational institutions are offered at the National University of Defense of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, one of the capital's military institutes became a leader in the study of foreign languages ​​among defenders.

Title: -Resetting- instead of rotation: the Russians are spreading the tactics of zombie attacks in Kurshch...
Description: The chief sergeant of the company of the 47th brigade told about this on the air of -Social News- Magura with the call sign -Azimuth-. -Currently, they have stopped using mechanized equipment. They started coming to us on quad bikes, motorcycles, and buggies. They try to do it quickly and inconspicuously. In small groups. Of course, they continue their assaults on foot in numbers of 3 to 5 people. They are trying to reach, to gain a foothold. Our artillery and our drones are doing a great job with this issue,- Azimut said. Also, according to him, the enemy is currently accumulating reserves in order to create a shock fist. Forms units at a distance of 5-7 kilometers from the contact line and tries to bring them into position. -But they have a problem with rotations. Our fire system is built in such a way that it is difficult for them to rotate. It is easier for them to simply replenish these positions. They have such a situation that they often simply -reset- their servicemen if they refuse an order or want to go back from their position,- said the serviceman. Earlier, ArmiyaInform reported on similar tactics of Russian troops, but in a different direction - Kharkiv. There go in a zombie- the assaults of the Russians compel's commanders. Those who refuse are simply killed.

Title: In Kharkiv Oblast, the evacuation of all children from a front-line village has been completed
Description: informed the head of Kharkiv OVA Oleg Synegubov about this. In particular, a 74-year-old man died as a result of a guided aerial bomb hitting his home in the village of Kivsharivka in the Kupyan district. And in the village of Podyla, a fence and three farm buildings were damaged due to shelling by the Russian army. In addition, in the city of Lubotyn and in the village of Kramarivka, Air Defense Forces shot down enemy drones. Also, 54 people, including one child, were evacuated from the Borivskyi and Kupyanskyi directions. The forced evacuation of children and their families from the village of Borova has been completed. All 119 children were evacuated.

Title: Oleksandr Syrskyi: The radio engineering troops are guarding the peace of millions of Ukrainians
Description: He wrote about this in his Telegram channel. -The radio engineering troops of the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine are the eyes of our air defense. They are the ones who guard Ukraine's airspace around the clock, detecting and tracking enemy planes, missiles, drones and other threats,- the general stressed. He emphasized that thanks to the work of these units, since the beginning of the large-scale invasion, hundreds of enemy planes, thousands of missiles and drones have been shot down. Most importantly, many lives of Ukrainians were saved. -Thank you for your service, courage and devotion to the Ukrainian people. Your work is a guarantee of security and peace of mind for millions of citizens,- Oleksandr Syrsky noted in his address. Radio engineering troops continue to be an important element of Ukraine's defense capabilities, remaining a reliable shield in the struggle for freedom and independence. As reported by ArmyInform, since the beginning of the large-scale invasion of Russia RTV servicemen recorded and accompanied more than 345,000 enemy targets, including 175,000 aircraft, 100,000 helicopters, 57,000 drones and more than 13,000 missiles.

Title: -They flew in for the money-: Scouts eliminated three more state-of-the-art radars of the Russians
Description: This was reported by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. In particular, the following units were affected: Fire work on the military facilities of the Russian occupiers continues. We will remind, on November 28 reconnaissance destroyed the Russian -podlyot- radar complex in Crimea, worth 5 million dollars. As reported by ArmyInform, at night on On November 29, an attack was made on the -Atlas- oil depot in the Rostov region of the Russian Federation. As a result of the damage, a fire broke out on the territory of the object, at least two sources of ignition were recorded.

Title: The enemy hit the Mykolaiv region with ballistic missiles: rescuers extinguished the fire
Description: This was informed by the head of Mykolaivska OVA Vitaly Kim. In the Kutsurub community, the enemy attacked twice with FPV drones. The shelling passed without casualties. In addition, the village of Dmitrivka, which is part of the Kutsurub community, came under artillery fire. As a result of the impact, the farm building was damaged, there were no victims. Also in the evening, the Mykolaiv district was hit by a ballistic missile. A straw fire broke out on the territory of the agricultural enterprise, which was quickly extinguished by rescuers. As reported by ArmyInform, in the Kherson region as a result of Russian shelling last day one person died, another six were injured.

Title: Night attack by drones: Air defense forces shot down most of the Shaheds
Description: The Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported this. As a result of air combat in Kyiv, Cherkasy, Kirovohrad, Dnipropetrovsk and Kherson regions, eight enemy drones were shot down. One UAV was lost in location, another one flew into the occupied territory. As reported by ArmyInform, since the beginning of the large-scale invasion of Russia RTV servicemen recorded and accompanied more than 345,000 enemy targets, including 175,000 aircraft, 100,000 helicopters, 57,000 drones and more than 13,000 missiles.

Title: 175,000 aircraft and 57,000 drones: Radio engineering troops keep the sky under control
Description: The Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported this. Radio engineering troops work around the clock throughout the territory of Ukraine, detecting aerial threats and transmitting information to command posts. Their work ensures the effective interaction of aviation, anti-aircraft missile forces, mobile fire groups and electronic warfare units, as well as timely warning of danger to the population. -When we write in the morning summaries: ``this night the radio engineering troops detected more than 150 aerial targets,'' know that behind this phrase lies the difficult and dangerous work of radar units scattered throughout the territory of Ukraine,- the message reads. <iframe loading=-lazy- title=-Day of radio engineering troops of the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine_2024!- width=-640- height=-360- src=-https://www.youtube.com/embed/udfQdvjIKTc?feature=oembed- frameborder=-0- allow=-accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media ; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share- referrerpolicy=-strict-origin-when-cross-origin- During enemy attacks, RTV remains on positions to quickly identify targets and coordinate their destruction. Many of them are now defending the country side by side with other units, actively participating in the destruction of enemy drones and missiles. -We thank the soldiers of RTV for their protection and professionalism, we honor those who have gone to eternity,- the department emphasized.

Title: Kherson region under fire: rockets, drones and enemy artillery
Description: This was notified by the head of Kherson OVA Oleksandr Prokudin. Last day, Red Lighthouse, Bilozerka, Tyaginka, Osokorivka, Petropavlivka, Stanislav, Antonivka, Kozatske, Mykilske, Odradokamyanka, Shiroka Balka, Novovorontsovka, Zmiivka, Monastyrske, Novoberislav, Romashkove, Dudchany, Zimivnyk, Prydniprovske, Dar' came under enemy fire. Yevka, Komysany, Sadov and the city of Kherson. Also, the enemy launched a ballistic missile attack on Beryslav district. As the head of the OVA noted, the Russian military hit the residential quarters of the populated areas of the region, in particular, they damaged 17 private houses. The occupiers also mutilated a garage, a communal building, a store, an outbuilding, and private cars. He added that during a nighttime drone attack, the Air Defense Forces destroyed one Shahed-131/136 over the territory of the region. As reported by ArmyInform, a resident of Kherson was hit by a Russian drone in the Dnipro district.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , decree: to start a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: The enemy has taken missile carriers to the Black Sea: there is a threat of using -Calibers-
Description: notified the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. There are no enemy ships in the Azov and Mediterranean seas. For a day, in the interests of the Russian Federation, passage through the Kerch Strait was carried out: The Russian Federation continues to violate the International Convention for the Protection of Human Life at Sea of ​​1974. (SOLAS) by disabling automatic identification systems. We will remind, The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine awarded marines. As reported by ArmyInform, tests were planned, and combat launches were carried out: the commander of the Navy told about the first attack by -Neptune-.

Title: Attack on Nikopol region: a man was killed, houses and infrastructure were damaged
Description: This was notified by the head of Dnipropetrovsk OVA Serhiy Lysak. Unfortunately, a 38-year-old man died. As a result of the attack, seven private houses were damaged, one of which caught fire, but rescuers promptly extinguished the fire. In addition, four farm buildings were destroyed and a power line was damaged. Infrastructure, an industrial enterprise and a truck were also destroyed. Restoration work is ongoing in the area. We will remind you that last day more than two dozen times a day the Russian chymalo-rujnuvan/->the aggressor hit Nikopolshchyna with artillery and drones. As ArmyInform reported, the occupiers are heavily shelling Zaporizhzhia: more than 500 hits per day.

Title: Defense forces damaged another important enemy object
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. However, the Defense Forces of Ukraine inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying forces and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. Yesterday, aviation and missile forces and artillery of the Defense Forces made two strikes on the areas of concentration of personnel and OVT, a control post and one other important enemy object. We will remind, last day of the loss of the Russian invaders made 1740 persons. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed five tanks, 12 armored combat vehicles, 23 artillery systems, two air defense systems, 42 UAVs of the operational-tactical level, 72 units of automobile equipment and two units of special equipment of the occupiers. As reported by ArmyInform, almost 200 assaults per day: the enemy intensified the offensive in three directions of the front.

Title: Almost 200 assaults per day: the enemy intensified the offensive in three directions of the front
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In addition, it carried out 4,663 attacks, 99 of them from rocket salvo fire systems, and used about 1,400 kamikaze drones for damage. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular, in the areas of the settlements of Kivsharivka, Oleksandro-Kalynov, Novoosynov, Hlushkivka, Hryhorivka, Serebryanka, Kostyantynivka, Uspenivka, Ulakly, Velyka Novosilka, Makarivka, Orihiv, and Kozatske. On the Kharkiv direction, seven enemy attacks took place in the districts of Kudiivka, Hlybokoy, Vovchansk and Tikhoi. In the Kupyan direction, there were eight attacks by the occupiers during the day. The defense forces repelled enemy assaults near Kolisnikivka, Lozova, Pershotravnevoy and Zeleny Gayu. In the Lyman direction the enemy attacked 20 times. Tried to advance near Grekivka, Novoehorivka, Terniv, Yampolivka, Dibrova, Torsky, Zarichny, Hryhorivka and in the Serebryansky Forest. In the Kramatorsk direction the occupiers attacked four times in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of White Mountain. On the Toretsk direction the enemy launched two attacks near Druzhba and Toretsk. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 41 assault and offensive actions of the aggressor in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Dachenske, Chumatske, Novy Trud and Zhovte settlements. In the Kurakhiv direction the defense forces repelled 46 attacks. The main efforts of the enemy were made in the districts of Sontsivka, Berestki, Novodmytrivka, Zori, Kurakhovo, Dachny, Dalny, Elizavetivka, Hannivka, and Uspenivka. In the Vremivsk direction the enemy carried out 26 assaults on our positions near Vesely Gay, Kostyantynopolskyi, Suhy Yalyi, Rozdolnyi and Novodarivka. It was actively used for strikes in the direction of attack and bomber aircraft. In the Dnieper direction Russian invaders attacked our positions five times. They were repulsed and suffered losses. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. Operation in Kursk Oblast is ongoing. Over the past day, our soldiers repelled 23 enemy attacks in this direction. We will remind, last day of the loss of the Russian invaders made 1740 persons. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed five tanks, 12 armored combat vehicles, 23 artillery systems, two air defense systems, 42 UAVs of the operational-tactical level, 72 units of automobile equipment and two units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: -You are the eyes of the Defense Forces of Ukraine-: The Minister of Defense congratulated the soldi...
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page. -You provide our air defense, aviation and mobile groups with critical information every day. Thanks to you, hundreds of enemy planes, thousands of missiles and drones were shot down, and most importantly, many lives were saved,- the minister said. Rustem Umyerov expressed gratitude for the vigilance, dedication and service that help protect Ukrainian cities, infrastructure and people every day. In particular, the greeting from the minister was a reminder of the contribution of the Radio Technical Forces to strengthening the defense of Ukraine during the war.

Title: The occupiers are heavily shelling Zaporozhye: more than 500 hits per day
Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhia OVA. Russian troops carried out 8 aerial attacks on Gulyaipol and Novoandriivka. In addition, 247 UAVs of various modifications attacked Bilenka, Lobkovo, Gulyaipole, Shcherbaki, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Mala Tokmachka, Biloghirya and Novodarivka. According to the head of the OVA, 22 shellings from the RSZV covered Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Mala Tokmachka and Novodarivka. As Ivan Fedorov noted, 241 artillery strikes were carried out on the territory of Lobkovo, Gulyaipol, Shcherbaki, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Malaya Tokmachka, Biloghirya and Novodarivka. -We received 5 reports about the destruction of residential buildings and infrastructure facilities. Civilians were not harmed,- he added. As reported by ArmyInform, more than two dozen times a day the Russian chymalo-rujnuvan/->the aggressor hit Nikopolshchyna with artillery and drones.

Title: ARVs, artillery systems and 1,740 occupants: the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine announ...
Description: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine informs about this. The total combat losses of the enemy from 24.02.22 to 30.11.24 are approximately: -Due to the constant arrival of detailed intelligence data, there was a need to adjust some positions of the total losses of the enemy - anti-aircraft missiles, anti-aircraft missiles, anti-aircraft vehicles, vehicles, special equipment. The total figure has been adjusted, and daily losses are reported as normal,- the agency said. As reported by ArmyInform, the General Staff of the Armed Forces named three directions, basic-zusyllya/->where the enemy concentrated the main efforts.

Title: One of the capital's military institutes has become a leader in the study of foreign languages ​​amo...
Description: About it in interview with ArmyInform was told by the head of the educational and scientific center of foreign languages ​​of the National Defense University of Ukraine, candidate of philological sciences, colonel Nataliya Vasyukova. -We will not talk about statistics. However, a large-scale invasion became an obvious challenge, because we had to train soldiers who spoke English because of the importance of working with partners, learning western technology, etc. With the beginning of a large-scale invasion, language training was somewhat suspended, as it was necessary to figure out how to deal with the current situation, where to go next. But studies at the NUOU were not stopped: the educational process continued, graduations took place, and, of course, the emphasis was placed on disciplines that involved the direct repulsion of aggression. But in the same year, two foreign language courses were held. One was completed at the beginning of February 2022, the second started in October 2022,- Nataliya Vasyukova said. She emphasized that it is not just about NUOU, as foreign language courses are available in all higher military educational institutions and military educational units of higher education institutions. -And this shows that since the beginning of large-scale aggression, these processes have not just stopped, they have even become more emphasized, thus emphasizing the importance of learning foreign languages. The only question was which institution, depending on the number of scientific and pedagogical workers and teachers, could afford a certain number of groups. Let's add that NUOU is the leader in terms of the number of students,- the interlocutor emphasizes. If we compare the year 2024 with 2022 in the context of learning foreign languages, Nataliya Vasyukova draws attention to not just listener interest, but -motivated interest.- -Because people, in accordance with their positions, which require knowledge of the language or in accordance with the range of tasks performed, understand the complete dependence in certain official situations on the level of English proficiency. And there is also the realization that taking the next step in one's professional development and career growth without knowing the language will be difficult, and sometimes completely impossible,- Nataliya Vasyukova summed up. As ArmyInform wrote, from 2024 in military universities three new specialization. Previously ArmyInform informed that at military universities this year the most popular specialties among women were and specializations that train commanders of mechanized units, units of Airborne Assault Forces and Special Operations Forces.

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces named three areas where the enemy concentrated its main effort...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In addition, the occupiers are actively attacking in the Lyman and Kupyan directions. The terrorist state launched a missile strike with one missile, 31 airstrikes, dropping 53 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, the invaders used 581 kamikaze drones for strikes and fired more than 3,000 shots at the positions of our troops and populated areas. On the Kharkiv direction, Russian terrorists stormed the positions of our units five times in the Kudiivka, Vovchansk, and Tikhoi districts. Two skirmishes are ongoing. Seven times the enemy attacked our positions in the Kupyan direction. In the vicinity of Kolisnikivka, Lozova, Pershotravnevoy and Zeleny Gayu, units of the Defense Forces repelled all enemy attacks. In the Lyman direction, Russian troops attacked Ukrainian defenders 20 times in the districts of Grekivka, Novoyehorivka, Terniv, Yampolivka, Dibrova, Torsky, Zarichny, Hryhorivka and in the Serebryansky forest. Our soldiers repelled 18 enemy attacks, two battles are ongoing. In the Kramatorsk direction Ukrainian soldiers repelled three attempts by the invaders to capture our positions in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of Bila Hora. In the Toretsk direction, the occupiers twice tried to advance in the Druzhba and Toretsk districts, but were repulsed. In the Pokrovsky direction, the aggressor attacked our positions 34 times in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Dachenske, Chumatske, Novy Trud and Zhovte settlements. Ten clashes are still going on. In the Kurakhiv direction, the invaders made 43 attempts to advance. 11 attacks continue. The main battles are taking place near Sontsivka, Berestki, Novodmytrivka, Zori, Kurakhovo, Dachny, Dalny, Elizavetivka, Hannivka, and Uspenivka. In the Vremivsk direction the aggressor stormed the front edge of our defense 24 times in the area of ​​Vesely Gay, Kostyantynopolskyi, Suhy Yali, Rozdolnyi and Novodarivka, currently three skirmishes are ongoing. In the Dnieper direction, the enemy made three unsuccessful attempts to storm the positions of Ukrainian units. The Defense Forces of Ukraine continue the operation in the Kursk direction. Ukrainian soldiers repelled 22 attacks of the invading army in this direction. Soldiers of the 68th Separate Hunter Brigade named after Oleksa Dovbush, the 92nd Separate Assault Brigade named after Kosh Ataman Ivan Sirk, and the 71st Separate Hunter Brigade of the DSHV were awarded for their effective combat work. As reported by ArmyInform, on the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy will continue to concentrate its main efforts around the town of Chasiv Yar, but the Defense Forces are holding their positions.

Title: Army English: about motivated new -blood-, conversation clubs with an attache... and not only
Description: About all this and not only the correspondent of ArmiyaInform asked in an interview the head of the educational and scientific center of foreign languages ​​of the National Defense University of Ukraine (hereinafter - NUOU), candidate of philological sciences, Colonel Nataliya Vasyukova. —How many military personnel did the specialists of your university manage to train since the beginning of the large-scale invasion? And during 2024? - We will not talk about statistics. However, a large-scale invasion became an obvious challenge, because we had to train soldiers who spoke English because of the importance of working with partners, learning western technology, etc. With the beginning of a large-scale invasion, language training was somewhat suspended, as it was necessary to figure out how to deal with the current situation, where to go next. But studies at the NUOU were not stopped: the educational process continued, graduations took place, and, of course, the emphasis was placed on disciplines that involved the direct repulsion of aggression. But in the same year, two foreign language courses were held. One was completed in early February 2022, the second started in October 2022. But it is not only about NUOU, because foreign language courses are available in all higher military educational institutions and military educational units of higher education institutions. And this testifies to the fact that since the beginning of large-scale aggression, these processes have not simply stopped, they have even become more emphasized, thus emphasizing the importance of learning foreign languages. The only question was which institution, depending on the number of scientific and pedagogical workers and teachers, could afford a certain number of groups. Let's add that NUOU is the leader in terms of the number of students. If we compare the year 2024 with 2022, it is worth paying attention to not just the interest of listeners, but motivated interest, because people, in accordance with their positions, which require knowledge of the language or in accordance with the range of tasks performed, understand complete dependence in certain official situations from the level of English proficiency. There is also the realization that taking the next step in your professional development and career growth without knowing the language will be difficult, and sometimes impossible. - Is the training of the military to learn a foreign language now about quantity or quality? - This is a provocative question, because the process of studying, mastering, gaining a new level in a certain direction, including a foreign language, is always a transition to a qualitatively new level. Therefore, it cannot be said that it is only about quantity. Let's talk about quality quantity in this context(smiles - ed.). - How do partners get involved in this training? - We knock on everyone. I can comment on the period of my two years in office. The initiative should always come from the interested party. And in this context, it is about creating a partnership network, first of all, within the Defense Forces. Yes, we try to communicate with all departments involved in foreign language education. We exchange materials, share experience, look for ways to improve educational and methodological support, etc. That is, it is an internal affiliate network. But we also knock on all the doors of our partners. In particular, within the framework of the strategy of internationalization in military educational institutions, the idea of ​​creating a patronage system is laid: when a certain educational institution of partner countries or NATO members takes a kind of patronage over a certain military educational institution. The implementation of this would help to create a partnership network between various educational institutions, which would work not only in the direction of studying general English (General English), but also - what is extremely important today - specialized narrow-profile terminology (English for Specific Purposes). In addition, last year we started the practice of conversation clubs for students of foreign language courses with the participation of defense attachés of the Kyiv Association of Military Attachés. Classes were held 2-3 times a month in the form of interviews, discussions with students according to their level of training. The goal was to consolidate the learned vocabulary and grammatical constructions in speech practice, as well as simply the opportunity to practice speaking, practicing typical communicative situations as close as possible to real ones with the participation of a native speaker (even if it is not his native language). During such classes, students learn to overcome the psychological barrier to start speaking a foreign language, because just as it is sometimes difficult to dare to take the first step, it is also difficult to say the first word, the first phrase in English (-will they understand me-, -will I not errors-). This year, this practice of conversation clubs has spread to other higher military educational institutions that conduct foreign language courses. - Are some subjects taught in a foreign language at the NUOU? - In the center of foreign languages, we definitely teach only in English. In addition, there is also English in research for future Ph.D. But both at the university and at other higher military educational institutions, in accordance with the governing documents and today's conditions, there is a requirement to teach 20% of subjects in a foreign language. Therefore, it is necessary to improve foreign language knowledge not only of listeners, but also of scientific and pedagogical staff. To do this, we cooperate both within the internal network and with foreign partners to create a course in the direction of English as a medium for teaching other disciplines (English-Medium Instruction or English as a Medium for Instruction). In this way, we maintain, acquire or expand the capacity to study and teach in English within the university. —What do you think is the current -room average temperature- for foreign language proficiency among the Armed Forces servicemen? —Thanks to the language testing sessions, I can see the statistics and can make a cut: in fact, so far the overall temperature is— disappointing, as it is cool outside the window now. But this new -blood- that appeared in the army with the beginning of the Russian Federation's large-scale aggression against Ukraine indicates a certain tendency to increase the temperature, I will use the same metaphor - as if the heating was turned on and it's getting warmer. Those who understood that it is very difficult to achieve anything in civilian life without a foreign language, it is difficult to find a well-paid job, it is more difficult to develop professionally - they made their choice in the civilian dimension. And now they are -inspiring- their fellow soldiers with their experience. Well, it is worth emphasizing that there are many servicemen who do not wait for an order or command to learn a language, do not look for people to blame for their ignorance, but look for opportunities and time, take the initiative and start learning on their own, strive to develop, listen to recommendations - because it is the main driving force and key to success in mastering languages ​​are internal motivations and desires. I can say with great pleasure that there are more and more of them. - Do you have enough time to learn foreign languages ​​in the third year of a large-scale war? - No! Unfortunately, we confirm the effectiveness of the proverb -until the thunder strikes...-. Yes, we have started to -baptize-, but the result will take time. If you try to meet all the current needs, I jokingly say that both I and my colleagues need to be cloned! (laughs - ed.) Language is not something you can do in one or two evenings, gain some understanding and more or less master it. Language is something that is trained over time: you train your brain, you train yourself, and it is through self-discipline that you learn. But it takes time. According to our guidelines, there are 500 hours of teacher-led study from level zero to level one, which is pretty intense, and that's the pace at which four-month foreign language courses are taught. And no less important in language learning is the fact that after reaching a certain level, it is necessary to constantly maintain it, so as not to lose it, to keep what has been acquired. After all, if you do not do this, the skills will disappear, not immediately and not completely, but will become passive. Currently, there are many ways to maintain language skills - smartphone apps, news adapted to language levels, even short 15-minute lessons - but systematic - would be very appropriate. For example, we recommend Elena Chekryzhova's -Army English- project to everyone, and we broadcast her lessons to the public on the territory of our center: even passing by, you can hear something new, learn a new term. - Do you cooperate with public organizations, non-governmental institutions to improve and deepen the study of foreign languages ​​by military personnel? - Yes, and the contribution of NGOs and volunteers should not be underestimated, because the civil sector is those who, on a voluntary basis, realizing the need for the military to be included in these processes; provide translation support where necessary; continue to work and help us both abroad and in Ukraine. From November 2024, on the basis of the Memorandum of Cooperation between the Mariupol State University and the National Defense University of Ukraine, permanent and temporary staff of the university will be granted free access to educational courses on the study of the English language on the English4Ukraine electronic platform. This is another example of effective civil-military interaction. - What are your plans for improving the English course(s) for 2025? - When I am asked about the state of affairs, I usually answer -at least not worse- (smiles - ed.). As for plans, it is even more difficult, but you can use the same phrase: indeed, in 2025, we do not want to reduce our current indicators, but to increase them, of course, only under the conditions of an increase in interrelated human capital (research and teaching staff, educational facilities), so that a year later during the interview, without taking your eyes off, talk about quality quantity. We want to open more opportunities for people who want to learn a foreign language. — What interesting, funny, curious incident can you remember related to the stay of our military in an English-speaking environment? During studies abroad, during communication with partners, etc. - All these curious cases are almost always related to not quite perfect command of the language. I don't want to call these cases funny, because it demotivates those who study, strengthens the psychological barrier to language use that I mentioned earlier. And I always insisted: speak, don't be shy. After all, the foreigner with whom you speak English speaks Ukrainian worse than you speak English. One should be demanding of oneself, but the level of self-criticism should not hinder practice. And don't be afraid to laugh, and maybe laugh at yourself sometimes. Sometimes the lack of vocabulary is compensated by the ability to draw well what you cannot say, or curious cases arise not only due to imperfect knowledge of a foreign language, but also due to ignorance of cultural features, so it is always worth conducting small linguistic and cultural reviews of the countries whose language is studied. From the latest that I remember: guys are calling me and telling me: -I tell her: ``Give me keys'' - English). I meant -keys-. And the foreign interlocutor did not hear -keys- but -give me kiss- (English). Then everyone laughed…

Title: -Scorpion- is ready to attack again: Turkish defenders are bringing a new version of the armored rec...
Description: In the official release of the manufacturing company emphasized that this versatile vehicle is distinguished by advanced weapons systems and extreme mobility, which makes it necessary for a variety of military missions, ArmiyaInform reports. The new version of BBM Akrep (-Scorpion- in Ukrainian) has added to the line of armored vehicles of Otokar Otomotiv ve Savunma Sanayi A.Ş., a subsidiary of the Turkish financial and industrial group Koç Holding, which specializes in the production of buses and military equipment and whose defense vehicles ArmiyaInform repeatedlyrelate Akrep II to the BBM of the universal segment. The armored two-axle vehicle stands out for its advanced weapons systems and extreme mobility, making it useful for a variety of military missions. Unrivaled maneuverability is achieved thanks to the all-wheel drive system and the additional rear steered axle. These capabilities allow the vehicle to effortlessly navigate difficult terrains, including deep mud, snowpack or water obstacles, as well as successfully overcome natural barriers in combat conditions. If necessary, the driver of the armored car can activate the crab mode, which provides the ability to move in a diagonal direction. In this mode, the rear wheels (see video below) turn in the same direction as the front wheels. If you turn the front and rear wheels in opposite directions, the turning radius is almost halved: the rear wheels steer the car in one direction, while the front wheels steer in the other. The ability to adapt to difficult circumstances makes the Akrep II an excellent option for armies that need a reconnaissance vehicle capable of operating in extreme conditions. The John Cockerilla tower has already received high praise and is recognized as a formidable combat platform. It is designed to integrate a variety of weapon systems, including a medium-caliber automatic gun up to 90 mm. This gun has high firepower and accuracy. The turret stabilization system proved to be an effective ally for conducting accurate fire. It provides the ability to perform aimed shots even while moving, and also allows you to hit targets in different directions at short and long distances. The Cockerill LCTS 90MP turret is distinguished by its high stability and safety due to minimal recoil, which makes it the optimal choice for light shooting systems. This gun works with high-explosive shells and has effective anti-armor capabilities, which allows it to successfully perform a variety of combat missions, including reconnaissance operations. The turret system has become widespread in different countries, in particular, there are more than 300 units in the arsenal. Akrep II is designed to operate with three crew members (driver, commander and gunner) and has a total mass of 15,500 kg. With a length of 5.9m, a width of 2.5m and a body height of 1.97m, as well as a ground clearance of 400mm, this car has a compact profile that contributes to its excellent performance on the ground. The Akrep II 4X4 light armored vehicle is offered in a variety of powertrain options, including diesel, hybrid and electric. These configurations are designed to meet specific operational requirements by reducing thermal and acoustic emissions, which are particularly important for operations requiring cloaking and reconnaissance. The diesel version of the car is equipped with a 360-horsepower engine and a 6-speed automatic transmission, which guarantees reliable operation even in the most difficult conditions. Regardless of configuration, this vehicle offers a number of standard features, including central tire inflation, radial tires with Run-Flat, anti-lock braking system (ABS), as well as air conditioning systems and heating. In addition, it is equipped with five-point seat belts and an advanced driver's vision system. Additional features include Drive-by-Wire technology, a filtering system NBC (Nuclear, Biological, Chemical), a self-extracting winch and a 360° situational awareness system that provides full visibility on the battlefield. Akrep II armored reconnaissance vehicle. Video: Defensehere

Title: Matdopomoga for solving social and household issues: amount and grounds for payment
Description: How much can be received and on what grounds, saysArmyInform. Payment of financial assistance for solving social and household issues is provided for resolution Cabinet #704 and order of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine No. 260. The procedure for its payment is determined annually by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine. For the year 2024, the payment is expected to gz-na-2024-rik.pdf->by separate order of the Minister of Defense dated January 16, 2024 No. 183/unit Material assistance for solving social and household issues is paid in the amount of monthly financial support (official salary, salary according to military rank, allowance for years of service and monthly additional types of financial support (except rewards) according to the position held). Grounds for payment in 2024: Assistance is paid to the families of servicemen who are captured (except servicemen who voluntarily surrendered) or hostages, as well as interned in neutral countries or declared missing. Write a report in the name of the commander, where it is necessary to explain the reason for such an appeal, as well as provide documents confirming the existence of grounds for payment. For example, if we are talking about payment due to injury, then you need to add a certificate about the circumstances of the injury (wounds, contusions, mutilations). However, this payment is not mandatory. In resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers it is stipulated that it is the right of the commander to provide such assistance within the limits of the available monetary support fund. If the payment is approved, it will be provided once in 2024. Also this year you can get help for the previous year 2023. This is possible if the event that led to the need to receive such assistance occurred in 2023 and the right to receive it was not exercised at that time. In 2025, the order and amount of payment may change. If changes occur, ArmyInform will tell about it.

Title: The Army that reads: about the project -Book on the front-, US experience and modern innovations -Cu...
Description: The project leader, Sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Andriy Ovcharuk, told ArmiyaInform about the significance of the book at the front, the connection with the experience of Great Britain and the USA during the First and Second World Wars, and modern Ukrainian innovations. - When did the -Book on the Front- project start and what prompted its appearance? - The -Book on the Front- project started in April 2023, and I joined it from March 2024. Since in civilian life I was the head of the Kyiv office of -Stary Lev Publishing House- - opened bookstores, was a bookseller and sold books myself, I readily agreed when I was offered to lead this project and develop it. I think this idea floated in the air, because such things have already happened before. During World War I, the British and Americans gave books to their troops. Then, during the Second World War, a huge campaign was organized in the USA, during which almost 123 million copies of the books were given to the servicemen of the US Armed Forces. These books simply went to all fronts, 155 thousand boxes were sent every month, each of which contained 40 different books. In total, they had a very large list of over 1,300 items. These included classics, contemporary American literature, entertaining books - westerns, detective stories, and more. — That is, there was a significant demand for books then. Is it the same now? — When many people who were civilians yesterday and are now mobilized join the army, they bring their everyday habits and needs to the army. Our Defense Forces now number hundreds of thousands, more than a million people, a significant number of whom have read in civilian life. Getting into the conditions of war, into the conditions of military service, they retain this need to read. There are also those who are trained as readers already in the army. Military personnel or those who have interacted with military personnel know very well that in the military there are quite often situations where you have to wait a long time. For example, sitting on your belongings until the transport arrives, or being on the guard of some objects, waiting for some task or resting after its completion. Typical are situations where a significant number of people have some free time that they have nothing to do. For many, the main entertainment is the phone, but we want to offer an alternative. The phone isn't always safe, it's not always smart, it's too easy a dopamine hit. In most cases, the phone is not useful, people lose concentration, and things like attention, imagination and concentration are very important in war. - Does the book help to preserve and develop them? - Yes, the book helps to concentrate and think, especially in conditions of uncertainty. When you don't know what to do, the book can help you find a non-standard solution to the situation. Therefore, we want the military to read books and do everything possible for this. -Cultural Landing- is a big project in which musicians, singers, poets, writers, puppeteers take part. People of many creative professions who worked in the field of culture in civilian life. Currently, groups of -Cultural Airborne- travel around military units in the combat zone, visit hospitals and rehabilitation centers, where they perform in front of the military. These can be different events: poet Artem Polezhaka reads poems, puppeteer Valery Dzhek performs plays, Myroslav Jonovich Kuvaldin from the band -The VYO- plays the guitar, Vitaly Kyrychenko sings songs, the most famous of which is -Good Morning, Ukraine-. And when our -Cultural Landing- groups come to the military, they take books with them. After the performance, after communicating with the fighters, they open a box of books and offer to choose something to read. Accordingly, the military choose something to their taste that they like. —Where does the Book to the Front project get the books it distributes to the military?—In the United States, since World War II, the program to supply books to the military has been supported at the state level. The government decided that this was important for the military, who had no other entertainment than reading - when boxes of books arrived, they would instantly take them apart, read them, and exchange them among themselves. It got to the point that after frequent reading, the books simply fell apart. This, by the way, caused a real book boom after the end of the war, because after returning to civilian life, former soldiers continued to read. Book publishing, the book industry experienced a boom - the book market doubled in the first half of the year, and then doubled again in the following year. In the end, it had a tremendous impact on the development of the entire country. For us, this is now happening on a voluntary basis, so the scale is disproportionate. If in the USA during the Second World War there were tens of millions of books, then we are talking about tens of thousands. We offer ordinary civilians, visitors to bookstores, book festivals to buy a book and donate it to the -Book on the Front- project. On this book, you can write a wish, leave a note for the military who will read the book. Having collected books in the rear cities of Ukraine, we hand them over to the -Cultural Landing- groups who go to the front, to educational centers, to military units, to hospitals, rehabilitation centers - wherever there are military personnel. - A paper book has a certain weight, takes up a certain volume - it is not always convenient for a soldier to take it with him. Instead, almost everyone has a smartphone in their pocket. Does the Book to the Front project practice e-book distribution? - Yes, there are several other initiatives within which the military can access e-books. There is an initiative from online bookstore Yakaboo called The Library for Heroes. We are also engaged in the dissemination of this initiative. The reading application has a separate library that contains more than 700 e-books, several dozen audiobooks. According to the promotional code, which can be obtained from us on the -Book on the Front- project, the soldier will have access to this library and can choose anything there. You really won't carry a lot of paper books with you. For example, after reading one book that was obtained during a meeting with the Cultural Landing, I realized that I wanted to read more. So here's your promo code, pick whatever you want, there's a lot to choose from. But paper books are also important, because it is not always possible to charge a phone - electricity is needed. And many people find it more convenient to read a regular paper book - you get used to it, it's nice to flip through the pages, feel them to the touch. - What is read most often, which genres of books are most often chosen and ordered? - Most often, military personnel read fiction books. They provide an opportunity to distract yourself from the military routine, from anxiety, worries about your life. They allow you to immerse yourself in another world, experience vivid emotions. How do imagination and emotions work? They help to relax, rest, switch off from complex thoughts a little. The book helps a lot in this. Of course, there are also people who like to read non-fiction - something serious, non-fiction, self-improvement books. Many people are interested in the experience of previous wars - historical books on military topics are also quite in demand and popular. It doesn't have to be books about our war—it could be books about the Vietnam War, World War II. It happens that comics are ordered, especially in hospitals and rehabilitation centers there was a request for comics. There was even a request from the military from the combat unit to give them the manga. - And poetry, collections of poems - are they ordered, read? - Of course, poetry is very attractive, because it is a short emotional text that helps you get to your own emotions very quickly. Reading an emotional poem, you yourself begin to feel everything more deeply. You can cry, you can laugh, you can experience many different emotions when you read poetry. Many of those who order books ask for poetry. Some resort to the spoken word in training centers, reading poems to motivate fighters during training. Now there are many bright, talented poets in the army. Artur Trony, for example, writes very strong poems. Unfortunately, a very strong poet Maksym Kryvtsov died, his poems became very famous. I have already mentioned Artem Polezhaku - this list can be continued for a very long time. Military service, reliving the personal experience of war prompts both to write and to read poetry. Therefore, poetry collections are chosen for reading quite often. I had an order from one hospital specifically for poetry, I organized the collection and transfer of more than fifty collections of poetry to them. - Where can a soldier put a book after reading it? - These books are gifts, they do not need to be returned. If it is a school, hospital or rehabilitation center, the book can stay in a local, often informal, library where it can be borrowed and read by others. Most often, books are given to siblings by exchanging books. You can also mail someone, family or friends, to read this book too. This allows you to share your emotions, find a common topic for conversation. Books allow military personnel to think more deeply about and relive their own experiences, and become an additional means of communication both among themselves and with those who remained in the rear. After all, a book is an extension of life. We don't know when the war will end, but life still goes on. And books help us to continue living even in the midst of the horrors of the present war.

Title: Breaking the truth: the Russians are circulating fakes about drugs in the army
Description: By keyword search experts from -Vox Ukraine- found the original source of the photo that was distributed by propagandists. The original photo appeared on the Facebook page of the patrol police of the Dnipropetrovsk region. Law enforcement officers seized drugs from a woman in the Samara district of Dnipro. However, there is no information in the police report that the detainee was a soldier. The propagandists cropped the original photo and passed it off as a package with drugs, which are allegedly distributed among the fighters of the 95th ODSHBr. The topic of drugs is extremely popular among Russian propagandists. Propagandists have repeatedly stated that drugs are used by Ukrainian military personnel, and that the narcotic substances themselves are grown in Ukraine by Americans in biolaboratories. In particular, we can recall fakes, as if the Armed Forces of Ukraine are creating a -universal soldier- with the help of drugs, and the Third OSH Brigade is forcing recruits to use narcotic substances. All these and similar -throwbacks- by the Russians are lies.

Title: Ukraine and Norway will increase joint work for the production of weapons and energy protection
Description: This was reported by the Office of the President. The head of state thanked for yesterday's decision of the parliament of Norway to increase aid to Ukraine for the next year from 1.4 billion dollars. up to 3.2 billion dollars. and especially noted its unanimous support by all parliamentary forces. Volodymyr Zelenskyy called this a true testimony of the Norwegian people's unwavering support for Ukraine. Separately, the President emphasized that part of these funds will go to Ukraine's own production of drones and other weapons. The leaders also discussed the priority needs of Ukraine. Against the background of Russian attacks on energy infrastructure, these are generators, other energy equipment and additional air defense equipment. In addition, Volodymyr Zelenskyi thanked for the recent reception of the delegation of Ukraine led by the Minister of Defense Rustem Umyerov and the help in establishing contacts between Ukrainian and Norwegian defense enterprises. As reported by ArmyInform, Volodymyr Zelensky discussed with the President of France for urgent strengthening of air defense of Ukraine, as well as for comprehensive defense support and acceleration of the transfer of Mirage aircraft.

Title: Online booking of employees: who and how can be booked through Diya
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine. The application is processed within three days. are wanted, and those who have not updated their data. Reservations may be refused after verification. The categories of employees subject to reservation under the new procedure and the amount of reservation depending on the authorities or enterprises (institutions and organizations) are defined in paragraphs 5-13 of Resolution 1332. span> Conscripts, who are necessarily subject to reservation, work in the following positions or in the following areas: Category positions -A-: Critically important enterprises: International and sports fields: Fuel and energy complex: Technical specialists: Specialists in the field of prosthetic and orthopedic production. 50% of conscripts are reserved for other categories of workers: Authorities and local self-government: Critical enterprises: International projects and humanitarian activities: Foreign companies and media: The Ministry of Defense can decide on increasing the number of employees subject to reservation, if necessary to ensure the functioning of important areas. These rules allow balancing the needs of the country's defense with the need to support critical sectors of the economy and management. As ArmiyaInform reported, the government is restoring the possibility of online booking of employees on the Diya portal from December 1. From now on, all applications will be submitted online.

Title: The enemy's BMP is burning and burning: our fighters are smashing Russian equipment -into pieces-
Description: Video of combat operation appearedon the page of the State Border Service of Ukraine. -It will burn and burn. As soon as enemy equipment comes into view, Ukrainian soldiers smash it to pieces. This is how border guards of the Kramatorsk detachment destroyed an enemy BMP with drones the other day. The equipment was reduced to scrap by well-aimed blows of the FPV operators,- defenders commented. Previously, ArmyInform showed how operators of UAVs attack border guards in Luhansk region destroyed and damaged 8 motor vehicles, a boat and a fuel truck.

Title: Rustem Umyerov: New personnel decisions are aimed at strengthening the army
Description: This was announced by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov. -Today, together with the President of Ukraine and the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Oleksandr Syrskyi, a number of important personnel decisions were made. According to my submission, the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky appointed a new commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — Major General Mykhailo Drapatoy,- Rustem reported moderated Also, an experienced commander of the 95th separate amphibious assault brigade was appointed Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Colonel Oleg Apostol. -I am convinced that the newly appointed leaders, who have combat experience, will make every effort to ensure the quality training of our servicemen and the effective performance of tasks for the defense of Ukraine,- the Minister of Defense noted. Rustem Umyerov thanked Lieutenant General Oleksandr Pavlyuk, who led the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces during a difficult period for the state, for his service. -His contribution to the defense of our country deserves respect. We continue to strengthen the Armed Forces to achieve the main goal — victory in the war and restoration of the territorial integrity of our state,- Rustem Umyerov concluded. As reported by ArmyInform, President Volodymyr Zelensky stressed on the need for changes in the structure of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and this is precisely why the new appointments are made.

Title: Say -Siiiiir-: on the mountain paths, two suspicious tourists got into the lens of the border guards
Description: This is reported by /a> State Border Service of Ukraine. According to the coordinates, the border patrol of the -Perkalab- department of the -Selyatyn- department went to the scene of the incident. Despite the attempts of the violators to escape, the border guards detained them after a chase, during which several warning shots had to be fired in the air. As it turned out, the detainees are residents of Ternopil region. They chose a difficult mountain route to illegally cross the border, hoping to avoid detection. Administrative materials were filed against the violators under Articles 185-10 and 204-1 of the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Shot down two -Shahed- in 15 minutes: the story of MANPADS operator -Loki-
Description: This is reported by Ground Forces. -Loki- is the operator of an anti-aircraft missile system in the 1129th anti-aircraft missile regiment of the Belotserkiv Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Before mobilization, Oleksiy worked as a loader, and in his free time he was engaged in programming and creating software. Today, it protects Ukrainian skies from air attacks. After the war, he plans to continue his service in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, Taras is a soldier of the Kherson anti-aircraft missile brigade, who yesterday, November 28, aimed at a Russian cruise missile from a portable anti-aircraft missile complex.

Title: The commander of the 93rd brigade - Kholodny Yar - became the deputy head of the President's Office
Description: The head of state said this in an evening address. -Combat commander, commander of the 93rd brigade -Kholodny Yar-. He understands well what is in the brigades, at the front. And I need just such a person to accurately know information directly from the front on a daily basis,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. Also today the President appointed Major General Mykhailo Drapatoy as the new commander of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and Colonel Oleh Apostol as the Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The President stated that Oleg Apostol will be responsible for the new quality of training of our soldiers and he has full support at all levels.

Title: The President explained the changes in the command of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Force...
Description: He said this in his evening address. -Together with the Commander-in-Chief Oleksandr Syrskyi, today we determined that it is worth replacing the commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Major General Mykhailo Drapaty was appointed as the new commander. Also, Colonel Oleg Apostol was appointed as the new deputy head of the Central Committee - before that he commanded the 95th brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi. He emphasized that both are very experienced warriors. Mykhailo Drapaty this year organized the defense in the Kharkiv direction and actually disrupted the Russian offensive operation. In general, he has been at war since 2014, in the most hot and responsible areas. Oleg Apostol is a Hero of Ukraine, has passed all the command positions in the units of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and has also been protecting our country since 2014. -He clearly knows what is needed to strengthen the combat capability of our army. Now Oleg Apostol will be responsible for the new quality of training of our soldiers. He has full support at all levels to ensure just that,- the President emphasized. Volodymyr Zelenskyi emphasized that the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces are the basis of the army and much depends for Ukraine on how effectively the structure of the Ground Forces and all Defense and Security Forces of Ukraine will work. -Changes are needed - changes in people management that will ensure more results on the battlefield,- the President said.

Title: The Defense Forces told about the unsuccessful attempts of the Russians to cross the canal in Chasov...
Description: A representative of the 24th OMbr named after King Danyla Andriy Polukhin. -The enemy has been trying to attack our positions in the city of Chasiv Yar in recent days. Their main tactic is to bypass our positions and impose a battle in the rear. But this week they also openly tried to storm, to carry out a mechanized assault. But they did not succeed, they lost a lot of equipment,- said Andriy Polukhin. According to him, the enemy is trying to complicate its offensive actions, and for this purpose it bypasses Chasiv Yar from different sides. He added that in the areas on our side of the canal, the enemy has not established a foothold, but is trying to penetrate in small groups. -Our boys identify them very quickly and work on them. The enemy is trying to accumulate forces in this way, but because of our drones, they are unable to do so,- Andriy Polukhin said. According to him, the canal itself is under fire control of the Defense Forces of Ukraine, and even if an enemy group crosses the canal, it is blocked and cut off from its forces. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 29 in the Kramatorsk direction, the invaders > carried out two assault actions near Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of White Mountain. There are currently two ongoing attacks by the occupiers.

Title: Why MRAP armored vehicles are the safest against mines
Description: Armored vehicles MRAP (from the English MRAP, Mine Resistant Ambush Protected - protection against mines and ambushes) - a class of military vehicles specially designed to protect the crew from undermining on min . The first armored vehicles under the MRAP system were produced back in the mid-70s. For the production of such cars, a special design and technological features were invented, which allow to protect the crew when hitting a mine. These machines have reduced the number of losses many times over. Due to the wedge-shaped bottom, the kinetic energy from the mine explosion is directed to the outside of the armored capsule. When making a V-bottom, it is important to maintain a certain angle. The sharper it is, the more energy is directed outwards and the better the crew is protected. At the same time, the sharp angle of the bottom increases the center of gravity and the height of the car, which reduces the car's rollover resistance and increases the height, vulnerability to anti-tank grenade launchers. When making an obtuse angle, the situation is reversed. The more obtuse the angle of the bottom, the worse the protection against a mine explosion, but the lower the center of gravity and the overall height of the armored car, which increases the protection against grenade launchers and other means of destruction. MRAP armored vehicles are designed according to the modular principle - a monolithic protected armored capsule and remote poorly protected external units: wheels, chassis elements, engine. The latter have an inertial fastening principle, that is, they absorb all the kinetic energy of the explosion. This design allows you to withstand detonation of powerful mines with minimal impact on the crew module. By the way, Formula 1 cars are designed according to a similar principle. Amortization seats and units. The design of landing seats in MRAP armored vehicles absorbs the kinetic energy of the explosion, saving the life of a serviceman. The seats are installed in the places of the least impact of the blast wave. During the explosion, the armor module moves, and the chair remains in place. According to a similar damping principle, other components are installed on armored vehicles so that during an explosion they do not harm personnel. For example, fragments of affected units fly out. Special design wheels. MRAP armored vehicles use wide, low-pressure tires with a high profile. Such tires create low pressure on the surface, so they do not activate the effect of anti-tank mines. The high profile of the tire serves as an additional explosion-absorbing factor. Strengthened ballistic protection. The armored capsule of MRAP vehicles is made taking into account the impact not only of small arms, but also of fragments from explosive devices of various strengths. An example of the application of safe technological solutions is the MRAP Buffalo. At the beginning of 2007, the US Army had 90 such vehicles in its arsenal. During the hostilities, they suffered more than 800 mine explosions without a single loss of crew. This fact provoked the Pentagon to start a program of complex procurement of such machines. The most popular foreign-made MRAP armored vehicles are Maxxpro, Casspir, Oshkosh, Mastiff, Bushmaster, Kirpi, etc. Ukrainian enterprises produce MRAP technology, in particular, armored vehicles of the Kozak, Varta, Novator, etc. families. And what about the MRAP technology in the Rosarmy? Objectively, the Russians also worked on this project. In the context of the large-scale rearmament and reform of the Rosarmy, which actively began after the Russian-Georgian war in 2008, and revived after the aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine in 2014, this technology was implemented. For example, we will give the most famous examples of armored cars that were developed by the Russians: It is worth noting one interesting detail. In the West and in Ukraine, armored vehicles, in particular with MRAP technology, are a class of armored vehicles for widespread use in the military. The Russians follow the policy of the Soviet empire: the best weapons and equipment are for the security forces, which are designed to protect the regime, and special forces. For ordinary infantry, a -three-line- is enough. Analyzing open data on orders in the Russian Federation for armored vehicles, in particular MRAPs, their main operators within the country are units of the Russian Guard, force units of the police (riot, sobr), FSB, etc. Paratroopers, scouts and sappers received BBM in the Rosarmy. But for the rest of the ground forces, the command of the occupying army is in no hurry to implement new technological and engineering security solutions, because the life and health of personnel is not a priority for them. Roman Zaporozhchenko for ArmyInform

Title: From December, employee bookings will only be available through Diya: new terms and conditions
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine. -Booking only through Diya: from now on, all applications will be submitted online. Paper orders have been replaced by an electronic system, which minimizes red tape,- the report said. New mandatory criteria: By February 28, 2025, businesses must confirm their critical status. If the company wants to book a new or already working specialist from December 1, the manager, when submitting the list for booking on the Diya portal, must confirm declaratively that the employee's accrued salary before paying all taxes will be at least 20,000. UAH This will allow the business to book new hires straight away if they meet the salary level requirements. This clause does not apply to state and communal enterprises, as well as residents of Diya.City. Enterprises that belong to one of the following categories can book conscript workers: Certain criteria must be met in order to receive the status of a critical enterprise. Mandatory Business Criteria: Additional Criteria, you must select at least one: Process for obtaining Critical Business Status: Businesses that have not yet upgraded but already have Critical Business Status will be able to book workers - this booking will be valid until February 28, 2025 and no longer than the criticality period. After updating the criticality under the new mandatory criteria, businesses will be able to book workers for up to 12 months, as before. As reported by ArmyInform, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, based on the results of the audit of enterprises and organizations that have the status of critical and have the right to reserve employees, decided to change the criteria.

Title: The GUR reported the number of ballistic missiles and artillery systems that the DPRK transferred to...
Description: This was reported by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine in response to a request from Interfax- Ukraine. The GUR noted that the DPRK began supplying artillery systems to the Russian Federation in October. In total, more than 100 pieces of equipment of various types were moved, including: 170-mm self-propelled artillery installations M-1989, 240-mm multiple rocket systems M-1991. The supply of large-caliber artillery ammunition and short-range ballistic missiles of the KN-23/24 type from the DPRK to the Russian Federation continues: as of November, more than 5 million units and 100 units have been delivered, respectively. -At present, more than 60 units of 170-mm self-propelled guns M-1989 Koksan have been moved from the territory of the DPRK to the territory of the Russian Federation, part of which was planned to be delivered to the Saratov VAKU, probably for the purpose of training personnel. There is no information on the state of the specified artillery systems,- the GUR added. As reported by ArmyInform, North Korean ballistic missiles KN-23/KN-24 identified components of foreign production.
